name: enceinte
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a wall surrounding a castle, cathedral, or fortified city (= one that is protected by walls): By midnight more than 75,000 soldiers were within the enceinte.
Syldavia/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThere were often areas of development which could not be accommodated within the enceinte. They had reached the southern part of the Bois de Boulogne, within less than 800 yards of the Paris enceinte.The moment of giving up the defence of the southwestern enceinte could not be far off.For a time, at the middle of the afternoon, the enceinte was absolutely without a guard.
